ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I will definitely recommend this class. The working load is reasonable and grading is fair.

If the course continues to be taught with an introduction to igneous and metamorphic rocks, it is maybe redundant with some undergraduate courses but for a non-geologist entering graduate student would provide a very solid foundation in "rock knowledge".For more experienced geologists, the course provides higher-level problem solving than was assigned in undergraduate courses.

I highly recommend this course to other students because the content of this course is basic to geosciences and the professor has the ability to guide you through all the abstract concepts in petrology.
A thorough introduction into the fundamental science behind understanding rock formation and evolution.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: My final review paper introduced me to ideas which are relevant to my research.
The professor is my research advisor; what I learnt from him in the past semester can be applied to my research directly, so this course benefits my dissertation.
I have a better understanding on the methods of inference used to constrain earth's history from the rock record.
